name: NSTitlebarAccessoryViewController
desc: An object that manages a custom view—known as an accessory view—in the title bar–toolbar area of a window.

items.name: var fullScreenMinHeight: CGFloat
items.desc: The visual minimum height of an accessory view that displays below the title bar when the window is in full screen mode.

items.name: var layoutAttribute: NSLayoutConstraint.Attribute
items.desc: The location of the accessory view, in relation to the window’s title bar.

items.name: func viewDidAppear()
items.desc: Called when the title bar accessory view controller’s view is fully transitioned onto the screen.

items.name: func viewDidDisappear()
items.desc: Called after the title bar accessory view controller’s view is removed from the window’s view hierarchy.

items.name: func viewWillAppear()
items.desc: Called after the title bar accessory view controller’s view has been loaded into memory is about to be added to the view hierarchy in the window.
